1.text: A soft answer turns away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

2.text: The tongue of the wise uses knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.

3.text: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

4.text: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

5.text: A fool despises his fatherâ€™s instruction: but he that regards reproof is prudent.

6.text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

7.text: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish does not so.

8.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

9.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but he loves him that follows after righteousness.

10.text: Correction is grievous to him that forsakes the way: and he that hates reproof shall die.

11.text: Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

12.text: A scorner loves not one that reproves him: neither will he go to the wise.

13.text: A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

14.text: The heart of him that has understanding seeks knowledge: but the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.

15.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart has a continual feast.

16.text: Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.

17.text: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

18.text: A wrathful man stirs up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeases strife.

19.text: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.

20.text: A wise son makes a glad father: but a foolish man despises his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walks uprightly.

22.text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

23.text: A man has joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!

24.text: The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

25.text: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.

26.text: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.

27.text: He that is greedy of gain troubles his own house; but he that hates gifts shall live.

28.text: The heart of the righteous studies to answer: but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.

29.text: The LORD is far from the wicked: but he hears the prayer of the righteous.

30.text: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart: and a good report makes the bones fat.

31.text: The ear that hears the reproof of life stays among the wise.

32.text: He that refuses instruction despises his own soul: but he that hears reproof gets understanding.

33.text: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honor is humility.
